title: Marriage Story and Uncut Gems Lead Gotham Awards Noms
text:
Photo: Netflix and STX

Gotham City, come get a look at this year’s best movies. On Thursday morning, the Independent Filmmaker Project (IFP) announced nominations for the 2019 IFP Gotham Awards. Marriage Story and Uncut Gems led the pack with three nominations each — Best Feature and Best Actor nominations for both, with Gems picking up a nomination for Julia Fox as Breakthrough Actor and Noah Baumbach’s nomination for Marriage Story’s script. Other nominations of note: Hustlers is up for Best Feature, and The Farewell is up for Feature and Screenplay. At last year’s Gothams, Toni Collette won Best Actress for Hereditary, and Ethan Hawke told us to quit it with the “tribal thinking.” The awards will be handed out December 2 at Cipriani Wall Street in New York.

Lulu Wang, director; Daniele Melia, Marc Turtletaub, Peter Saraf, Andrew Miano, Chris Weitz, Jane Zheng, Lulu Wang, Anita Gou, producers (A24)

Lorene Scafaria, director; Jessica Elbaum, Elaine Goldsmith-Thomas, Jennifer Lopez, Benny Medina, Will Ferrell, Adam McKay, producers (STXfilms)

Noah Baumbach, director; Noah Baumbach, David Heyman, producers (Netflix)

Josh Safdie, Benny Safdie, directors; Scott Rudin, Eli Bush, Sebastian Bear McClard, producers (A24)

Waves

Trey Edward Shults, director; James Wilson, Kevin Turen, Trey Edward Shults, producers (A24)
